meanings.definition: A yellowish liquid with a strong buttery flavor and odor, used as a flavoring agent in food and beverages.
meanings.sent1: The diacetyl added a rich buttery taste to the popcorn.
meanings.sent2: I could smell the diacetyl in the freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The diacetyl decided to join the party and make everything taste like butter!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like diacetyl, spreading warmth and joy around the room.
meanings.sent5: The diacetyl danced on my taste buds, leaving a delicious buttery sensation.

meanings.definition: A compound with the chemical formula C4H6O2, produced during fermentation and found in certain dairy products.
meanings.sent1: The diacetyl in the cheese gave it a unique tangy flavor.
meanings.sent2: Fermentation can sometimes produce diacetyl in beer, giving it a buttery aroma.
meanings.sent3: The diacetyl and the lactose had a race to see who could make the milk tastier.
meanings.sent4: His words were like diacetyl, subtly changing the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The diacetyl in the yogurt created a creamy and indulgent experience.
